snippet: A man accused of shooting a guard at the office of a prominent conservative group “has strong opinions with respect to those he believes do not treat homosexuals in a fair manner,” an affidavit said.
abstract: Court papers indicate that Floyd L Corkins II, Virginia man accused of shooting a guard at the Washington offices of prominent conservative group Family Research Council, took issue with the group's opposition to gay rights.

byline.original: By THEO EMERY and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

lead_paragraph: A man accused of shooting a guard at the office of a prominent conservative group “has strong opinions with respect to those he believes do not treat homosexuals in a fair manner,” an affidavit said.

headline.seo: Officials Indicate Politics Drove Shooting at Family Research Council
headline.main: Family Research Council Shooting Possibly Driven by Politics
headline.print_headline: Role of Politics Is Seen in Shooting of Guard at the Offices of a Conservative Group

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
